t_citizen_journalist_4_tell_someones_per: Take additional shots if needed. When you have a shot of the place that you feel happy with, continue with your shots below.
Record the person's face and expression.
Ask; What is your name, how old are you, where are you from, and what is/was your occupation?
This guide involves three scenes. You'll capture the person, their surrounding environment, and finally interview them.
Now is time for the interview. Remember, this is a personal/emotional story. First, ask the person to introduce themselves to your audience.
Record the person around their living environment, show the whole person in your frame.
Beginner |

Now that you have introduced the person, it is time to ask some personal questions, like their hopes, dreams, tragedies, fears, has something changed their course in life, and what makes their story compelling.
Tell Someone's Personal Story!
Record another angle of the person, for example from behind, or from the side.
Watch My Personal Story! This guide will help you tell the personal and emotional story of a person whose story you think should be heard by the public.
Now focus on showing them in their environment and showing what their day looks like.
Set the scene, show where the person lives.
If possible, record the person's body elements, such as face and hands.
Ask- What do you want to tell us about yourself?
Ask- Do you think your hopes and dreams can still happen?
Show their daily routine such as; working, washing dishes, planting in the garden, walking around, being with family.
Feel free to ask more questions, or record additional shots of the person. Consider interesting shots, such as very close up, high, or tilting the camera left or right.
When you have enough clips, you can arrange them below, by pressing the 'Order' button. You can trim individual clips, by tapping their thumbnail image.
Watch my personal story
It is time for more personal questions. If they become emotional, capture a close up shot of their face, especially the eyes.
Ask- What are/were your hopes and dreams?
